newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft to increase basic research spending.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to increase basic research spending.

text.p: The Microsoft Corp plans to increase spending for basic research by 300 percent in 1997, The New York Times reported on Monday.
The increase will create the world's largest computer science laboratory within the next two years, the newspaper said.
The decision comes at a time when other computer research giants are generally cutting back on fundamental research and focusing on product oriented projects, it said.

Microsoft is making a basic research investment, which will run as high as $330 million during the next five years, at least in part to make a statement about its executives' concern about changing national scientific research priorities, the newspaper said.
